p.s: The British prime minister Boris Johnson delivered a speech for the opening ceremony of the World Leaders Summit COP26 the 1 November 2021 in Glasgow.
The topic of the speech is the climate crisis and the urgency to act upon it.
The speech was held in front of the assembled state leaders from all around the world and a televised audience.
In the beginning of his speech, Johnson adresses the immeadiateimmediate threat, that is climate change.
He describes it as an impending menace, that the crisis is completely man-made and a result of about 200 years of industrialization.
He then goes on describing the importance and the role of the conference.
According to him COP26 is of extreme importance, because it can change the course of history.
Johnson predicts the yet unborn generations to be very angry, if the conference fails.
He also mentions, that the world leaders leave to reach an agreement and come to a decision now, otherwise the promises and achievements of climate conferences in the past will be worth nothing.
